Euclidean geometry

1. Revision


ID is: 1566 Seed is: 9895

Circle geometry terminology

Select a word from Column B that best fits the description in Column A:

Answer:
Column A Column B
A special chord that stretches from one point on the circumference to another point on the circumference and that passes through the centre of a circle.
A line that makes contact with a circle at one point on the circle.
The part of the circle that is cut off by a chord.

ID is: 1566 Seed is: 4665

Circle geometry terminology

Select a word from Column B that best fits the description in Column A:

Answer:
Column A Column B
A special chord that stretches from one point on the circumference to another point on the circumference and that passes through the centre of a circle.
A line that makes contact with a circle at one point on the circle.
Any straight line segment from the centre of the circle to a point on the circumference.

Adapted from DBE Nov 2015 Grade 11, P2, Q11
Maths formulas

    Also,
    ∴∠𝐸1=∠𝑇3∴∠E1=∠T3

  2. Prove that 𝐸𝐹EF is a tangent to the circle at 𝐸E.

    Here is the diagram again:

    Answer:
    Statement Reason
    ∠𝑇3=∠𝐶∠T3=∠C
    Also, (proven above)
    ∴∴
    ∴∴ 𝐸𝐹EF is a tangent to the circle at 𝐸E

  3. Prove that 𝐹𝑇FT bisects 𝐸𝑇̂ 𝐵ET^B.

    Here is the diagram again:

    Answer:
    Statement Reason

    But, ∠𝑇3=∠T3=
    ∴∠𝑇2=∠𝑇3∴∠T2=∠T3
    Therefore, 𝐹𝑇FT bisects ∠𝐸𝑇𝐵∠ETB.

    Answer:

    ∠𝑂2=2∠𝐽∠O2=2∠J ∠∠ at centre = 2∠2∠ at circum.
    ∠∠s in a rev.
    ∴∴
    ∴∠𝐻+∠𝐽=180°∴∠H+∠J=180°

    ∴∴ =90°=90°

    But, the line 𝑃𝑀PM, produced to the circumference, is a of the circle
